title: ‘Drunk’ plane passenger threw up in woman's hair before crew wipe it with tissue

A drunk plane passenger was thrown off a plane after vomiting into a woman's hair, leaving the cabin crew with the unenviable task of cleaning her up.

The passenger was reportedly forced to wash her hair in a sink after a boozed-up man was sick on her head.

Footage taken immediately after the incident shows a member of the cabin crew wiping her hair with a tissue to remove the last traces of vomit.

All of the people on board the Spirit Airlines jet, which was about to fly from Chicago to Baltimore, had to disembark so a deep clean could take place.

According to The Sun , the co-pilot joked with passengers: "This stuff only happens on my Vegas flights, never happens in Chicago.

"If anybody else is drunk, please get off the airplane now."

The flight was further delayed when two passengers, also believed to be drunk, locked themselves in a toilet on the aircraft.

The plane finally took off after cabin crew managed to coax the pair out.

It comes after a drunk passenger downed half a bottle of premium vodka and flung insults at women on a plane.

Martins Erdmanis had been drinking alcohol ahead of the easyJet flight from Budapest to Manchester at 10.30am on September 9 this year.

As soon as the 39-year-old entered the plane he fell over, one witness said, before he stumbled around and bumped into passengers attempting to take their seats, Manchester Evening News reported.

Once he sat down he produced a bottle of Grey Goose vodka and started pouring it into orange cartons, Manchester Magistrates Court heard.

He explained to officers that he did not know that being drunk on a plane was illegal before admitting having had half a bottle of vodka.

Erdmanis, of Slade Road, Birmingham, pleaded guilty to one count of entering an aircraft when drunk/being drunk in an aircraft.

He was handed a two-month community order made up of a curfew from 9pm to 5am and told to pay £325 in court and compensation costs.
